intro: Browallia condornadae, commonly known as the Socotra starlingflower, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant has small, velvety leaves and thrives in arid, rocky environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
